definition: to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish

sentences.english: At his death, he had lost about a third of his weight and had only a few dollars.
sentences.chinese: 他死时，体重锐减约三分之一，而且身上只剩几文钱。

sentences.english: By 2005, that number had dwindled to 21, 000.
sentences.chinese: 到了2005年，这个数字锐减到2万1千条。

sentences.english: Long-term dependence on U. S. and European markets plummeted Indian software outsourcing orders.
sentences.chinese: 长期依赖于欧美市场的印度软件外包订单锐减。

sentences.english: The distance the high-heel wearers could flex their feet up and down was also drastically reduced.
sentences.chinese: 穿高跟鞋的女性，她们能够上下活动脚的距离锐减。

sentences.english: Currently, China's export volume is suffering a sharp drop and the trade surplus is decreasing significantly.
sentences.chinese: 目前我国外贸出口数量锐减，贸易顺差额明显下降。

sentences.english: As demands for this product are very keen, our stocks are getting low very fast.
sentences.chinese: 由于最近对此商品的需求甚殷，使我们存货锐减。

sentences.english: The results showed that the grain yield and rice quality decreased under the conditions of thin plough layer.
sentences.chinese: 结果表明，薄耕层使米质变劣，产量锐减。

sentences.english: The result of Han immigrant is, greatly reduction of SHE population and possible disappear of SHE ethnic.
sentences.chinese: 汉化的结果是畲族人口的锐减和行将消失。

sentences.english: The number of tigers has reduced abruptly in the last fifty years.
sentences.chinese: 在曩昔的五十年里，山君的数量锐减。

sentences.english: The dry spell quickly diminished our water suply.
sentences.chinese: 干旱期使我们的水供应锐减。

definition: to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to shrink (in the wash)/fig. to shrink (of profits etc)
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
(of soil etc) to wash away/to be eroded/(fig.) (of talented staff, followers of a religious faith, investment funds etc) to go elsewhere/to fail to be retained
